author: cbc
title: Dieppe's new skating oval closes indefinitely
text:
Dieppe's brand new $1.4-million skating oval is being shut down indefinitely.
The refrigerated outdoor rink, which opened just before Christmas and closed briefly in January because of technical issues, is now being shut down indefinitely.
Dieppe's new skating rink to open before Christmas
Dieppe's new skating oval closed for repairs
City officials said mild temperatures over the last few days showed a persistent problem with the refrigeration piping.
Crews were on site Wednesday afternoon to analyze the damage and the city expects to have more information on the problem by Thursday.
Residents disappointed Residents who passed by the oval Wednesday hoping to go for a skate were disappointed to hear the news of its closure.
Linda Robichaud (left) and Louise Morais (right) were hoping to go skating Wednesday afternoon. (CBC)
"It's a nice place to skate, outside, fresh air," said Linda Robichaud. "We were planning a work activity here but I guess we won't have it."
"For all the money they put in there, it hasn't been used a lot,'' she added.
"It's supposed to work whether it's hot or cold outside," said her colleague Louise Morais. "It's unfortunate."
The city said the weekly Fun on Ice show scheduled for Friday will still take place.
